view

Class View

  • java.lang.Object
    • view.View

  • public class View
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manage the display of the project.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static View getInstance()
        Retrieves an instance of View. Retrieves the instance of the View, there can be only one instance of the View at once thanks to the singleton design pattern.
        Returns:
        Instance of View.

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage stage,
                  Graph g,
                  View.OnPlayListener playing)
        Start the View.
        Parameters:
        stage - Stage used for the graphical interface.
        g - the Graph to display.
        playing - Listener to launch the game.

      • resetFrame

        public void resetFrame()
        Reset all display of the labyrinth.

      • drawFrame

        public void drawFrame(javafx.stage.Stage stage,
                      int nbrX,
                      int nbrY)
        Draw the labyrinth basis. Draw the main structure of the labyrinth (e.g borders of the labyrinth).
        Parameters:
        stage - Window where we draw the labyrinth.
        nbrX - Height of the labyrinth.
        nbrY - Width of the labyrinth.

      • drawWall

        public void drawWall(int xs,
                     int ys,
                     int xt,
                     int yt,
                     javafx.scene.paint.Paint color)
        Draw a line between two points. This method is used to build walls in the labyrinth. Draw a line between two points given in parameters (with their coordinates). Color of the wall is also set by this method.
        Parameters:
        xs - abscissa of the first point.
        ys - Ordinate of the first point.
        xt - Abscissa of the second point.
        yt - Ordinate of the second point.
        color - Color of the wall.

      • drawGraph

        public void drawGraph(Graph g)
        Draw the structure of the labyrinth according to the graph which is linked. Call several times drawWall.
        Parameters:
        g - The graph which describe the labyrinth.

      • createEnnemies

        public void createEnnemies(int x,
                           int y)
        Create and add to the panel the sprite of an enemy in the labyrinth.
        Parameters:
        x - The Abscissa of the enemy.
        y - The Ordinate of the enemy.

      • createCandy

        public void createCandy(int x,
                        int y,
                        java.lang.String imgPath)
        Create and add to the panel the sprite of a candy, which is different according to imgPath.
        Parameters:
        x - The Abscissa of the candy.
        y - The Ordinate of the candy.
        imgPath - The name of the path of the sprite of the candy.

      • removeCandy

        public void removeCandy(int idx)

        Parameters:
        idx - The index on the set.
